contentTypes.name: Snippets
contentTypes.description: Snippets are reusable blocks of content that can be added to Pages or Layouts.

contentTypes.name: Page Components
contentTypes.description: A Page Component contains the content to fill out a Layout Component for a particular Page.

contentTypes.name: Layouts
contentTypes.description: Layouts define how content is arranged on a page.   They can include references to snippets, other widgets, page content, and more

contentTypes.name: Pages
contentTypes.description: Top level pages that include layout and maybe content

validations.message: The page slug can't start with `/`, `https://` or `absorblms.com`. All of these will be added automatically.
Do not include "| Absorb LMS" it will be automatically included
Must use a Layouts item for layout

contentTypes.name: Layout Components
contentTypes.description: Building blocks (columns, headers, footers, carousels) that compose Layouts

validations.message: Only bold, italic, underline, and code marks are allowed

contentTypes.name: Colored Text
contentTypes.description: A text element that uses multiple colors to highlight different words

contentTypes.name: Videos
contentTypes.description: Video assets that are hosted remotely, made into a reference type to be included in Content and in other Entry types.

contentTypes.name: Features
contentTypes.description: Blocks of text arranged next to an optional Asset

contentTypes.description: Cards with a large illustration icon and optional link -- usable for explore blocks and value props.

contentTypes.description: Configure SEO meta data for each page. Meta description, canonical URL, Sitemap priority, etc.

defaultValue.en-US: Absorb LMS is a learning management system built to accelerate learning and drive results. Our learning platform focuses on all of your learning and development needs in one place.

validations.message: Must be between 0 and 1 (decimals allowed). Select -1 to exclude from the Site Map

contentTypes.description: Used to image optimization and multiscreen considerations (different image for mobile than for desktop).

settings.helpText: Configure Layout attributes
All properties in this JSON object will be added to the scope when rendering the associated Layout Component.  Use this field to customize colors, text displays, custom images via asset ID, etc.
This field allows you to wrap your overall layout content in HTML.  Use the <layout-content/> tag or the {{layoutContent()}} magic tag to insert the Content for this layout
Layout components that are referenced by name from the HTML Template must be included as a reference here.  Components embedded in the Content editor do not need to be included here.
The slug becomes the page URL. https://
Configure SEO meta data for each page. Meta description, canonical URL, Sitemap priority, etc.
All properties in this JSON object will be added to the scope when rendering the Page's associated Layout.  Use this field to customize colors, text displays, custom images via asset ID, etc.
This image will display when the page shows up in search results.
This field is only used within Contentful to identify text. It is not used on the frontend.  Use color#/text# pairs to create colored text.
Choose a font weight for Color 1
Choose a font weight for Color 2
Choose a font weight for Color 3
Choose a font weight for Color 4
Choose a font weight for Color 5
Choose a font weight for Color 6
Either paste a Youtube ID in here or choose a Wistia video below.  If you do both, the Youtube ID takes precedence and the Wistia video will not be shown.
Optionally, show a playlist by entering the Youtube playlist ID
You will not be able to disable related videos. Instead, if this option is set to "Yes", related videos will come from the same channel as the video that was just played.
Number of Minutes
If Video Asset is set to a video, Image Asset will be ignored.
Set the gap between the columns. The lower the number, the smaller the gap
Keep the colums even by default or make one side bigger than the other
Pick a shape from 1-10. Use '0' for no shape.
Choose a Shape color
Rotate the Shape by number of degrees
Flip the Shape horizontally or vertically
Desktop: Adjust the shape's vertical position by amount of pixels. Negative numbers also accepted.
Desktop: Adjust the shape horizontal position by amount of pixels. Negative numbers also accepted.
Mobile: Adjust the shape's vertical position by amount of pixels. Negative numbers also accepted.
Mobile: Adjust the shape's horizontal position by amount of pixels. Negative numbers also accepted.

Use "prop: number; prop: number" (like CSS but with px implied) to set padding values. Possible properties: paddingTop, paddingTopTablet, paddingTopDesktop, paddingBottom, paddingBottomTablet, paddingBottomDesktop.
The Title is what will appear on the card in the UI, this can be different than the Name.
Add custom button link text
The Title field will be used for the bold title of this illustration card. All other content should go in this field.
If the card collection is configured to show "Read More" links, choose the page or entry that this card should link to.
If this field is set to the URL of a page to link to, the value of Linked Page is ignored. Preference should be given to using Linked Page when linking to an internal Page.
Set this field to the last path element of the existing case-studies article to link to. If there is not an article yet, leave blank.
This is the internal name, which end users will not see.
This is the event title which will be visible to end users.
The description which will show to end users.
Use this date when you need a date range.
Customize the button text. Default is "Learn More"
Enter a unique page description for the meta description tag & SEO
Optionally enter a canonical URL, in case this page replaces a page at a previous address. http://www.absorblms.com/ will be automatically added
Set the page priority for the Sitemap. Select -1 to exclude from the Site Map.
How frequently the page is likely to change. This value provides general information to search engines and may not correlate exactly to how often they crawl the page.
JSON-LD structure based on schema.org. Please validate your schema at https://validator.schema.org/
Name of Image for all versions, applied to image SEO and Accessibility attributes
REQUIRED for Accessibility and SEO: plain text description of image set for accessibility and SEO
There must be At Least 1 version, and versions should be ordered Smallest to Largest.
Additional Meta Data for the image not accounted for in the model.
Add Location Data to the image when needed.
Makes Links accessible to users reliant on screen readers. "Learn More" is not specific when someone cannot see context, "Learn More About LMS Compliance" is a good example of how to use this.
#anchor, /section/page, https://www.site.com/section/page are all valid examples.
Should the link open in the same window (_self DEFAULT), in a new window (_blank), ...
Tailwind Classes not yet handled by the Layout Config: Grid, Padding, Margin for now.
Layout Map for any component
Title should contain "Layout Setup" e.g. Layout Setup: Our Company - Hero
Currently Width Dimensions, Height and Top,Right, Bottom, Left coming
Tells an element how to behave in relationship to its siblings, and sets the behavior of child elements.
Static is default, and does not take a configuration. Most common will be "relative."
Particularly for Items in Flex and Grid layouts. Overrides inheritance from container.
Add internal padding to container.
Margin Settings: This should be used rarely to setup margins for an element.
Very the minor things which are not yet covered in the layout config.
Add Images to the container, this is optional. You can have both images and components.
HTML Web Component Markup
Title should include "Tablet Padding" e.g. Tablet Padding: Our Company - Hero
Applied to all 4 sides: 0 is no padding increases by increments of 4px up to 12, then 8px for 14 & 16,  and by 16px btwn 16 and 20+.
Applied to top of element: Applied to all 4 sides: 0 is no padding increases by increments of 4px up to 12, then 8px for 14 & 16,  and by 16px btwn 16 and 20+.
Applied to right side of element.Applied to all 4 sides: 0 is no padding increases by increments of 4px up to 12, then 8px for 14 & 16,  and by 16px btwn 16 and 20+.
Applied to bottom of element. Applied to all 4 sides: 0 is no padding increases by increments of 4px up to 12, then 8px for 14 & 16,  and by 16px btwn 16 and 20+.
Applied to left side of element.Applied to all 4 sides: 0 is no padding increases by increments of 4px up to 12, then 8px for 14 & 16,  and by 16px btwn 16 and 20+.
Title should contain "Mobile Padding" or "Default Padding" e.g. Default Padding: Our Company - Hero
Applied to all 4 sides: 0 is no padding increases by increments of 4px up to 12, then 8px for 14 & 16,  and by 16px btwn 16 and 20+.
Applied to top of element: 0 is no padding increases by increments of 4px up to 12, then 8px for 14 & 16,  and by 16px btwn 16 and 20+
Applied to right side of element. 0 is no padding increases by increments of 4px up to 12, then 8px for 14 & 16,  and by 16px btwn 16 and 20+.
Applied to bottom of element. 0 is no padding increases by increments of 4px up to 12, then 8px for 14 & 16,  and by 16px btwn 16 and 20+.
Applied to left side of element. 0 is no padding increases by increments of 4px up to 12, then 8px for 14 & 16,  and by 16px btwn 16 and 20+.
Title should contain "Desktop Padding" e.g. Desktop Padding: Our Company - Hero
Applied to all 4 sides: 0 is no padding increases by increments of 4px up to 12, then 8px for 14 & 16, and by 16px btwn 16 and 20+.
Applied to top of element: 0 is no padding increases by increments of 4px up to 12, then 8px for 14 & 16, and by 16px btwn 16 and 20+.
Applied to right side of element. 0 is no padding increases by increments of 4px up to 12, then 8px for 14 & 16, and by 16px btwn 16 and 20+.
Applied to bottom of element. 0 is no padding increases by increments of 4px up to 12, then 8px for 14 & 16, and by 16px btwn 16 and 20+.
Applied to left side of element. 0 is no padding increases by increments of 4px up to 12, then 8px for 14 & 16, and by 16px btwn 16 and 20+.
Title should contain "Mobile Margin" or "Default Margin" e.g. Default Padding: Our Company - Hero
Checking this will take precedence over any Margin Left or Margin Right settings, and will apply the value "auto" to both.
Steps of n(4px)
Steps of n(4px)
Steps of n(4px)
Steps of n(4px)
Steps of n(4px)
Title should contain "Grid Item Attributes" e.g. Grid Item Attributes: Card - 4 Reasons to Absorb
Vertical alignment in grid space, "stretch" is default.
Horizontal Alignment in Grid Space. Stretch is default.
Title should contain "Sticky Position" e.g. Sticky Position : Nav Item - Tabs
Vertical position relative to Top of parent container.
Vertical position relative to Bottom of relative parent container.
Place this item above other items in the page. Default is 0.
Title should contain "Relative" e.g. Relative: Our Company - Hero
0 is default, it is the bottom of the stack.
Title should include "Fixed Position" e.g. Fixed Position: Hover Widget - Support
Vertical position relative to Top of parent container.
Horizontal position relative to Left of parent container.
Vertical position relative to Bottom of relative parent container.
Horizontal position relative to Left of relative parent container.
Place this item above other items in the page. Default is 0.
Title should contain "Absolute Position" e.g. Absolute Position : Hero - Badge
Vertical position relative to Top of parent container.
Horizontal position relative to right side of parent container.
Vertical position relative to Bottom of relative parent container.
Horizontal position relative to Left of parent container.
Place this item above other items in the page. Default is 0.
Title should include "Display Inline". e.g. Display Inline: Our Company - Hero
Title should contain "Display Grid". e.g. Display Grid: Our Company - Hero
Number of Columns in Grid
Number value, will be converted to PX.
Title should include "Display Flex" e.g. Display Flex: Our Company - Hero
Only Set this if you want the orientation to be different on phone
Flex Direction: Row is Default, row should only be chosen if you have to force direction.
Mobile Wrap Behaviour for Flex Container. Only Set this if you want the way items wrap to be different on phone
To wrap or not to wrap the Default is nowrap
On Mobile, Justify Content on axis. e.g. x-axis if flex-direction is row, y-axis if flex-direction is column.
Justify Content on axis. e.g. x-axis if flex-direction is row, y-axis if flex-direction is column.
On Mobile, Align Items on cross axis. e.g. y-axis if flex-direction is row, x-axis if flex-direction is column.
Align Items on cross axis. e.g. y-axis if flex-direction is row, x-axis if flex-direction is column.
Defaults Flex-Start, tells grouping of children how to fill vertical space. Differs from Align-Items but works on same axis.
Gaps btwn items in container. These map directly to tailwind increments, and generally are steps of 4px
Title should include "Display Block" e.g. Display Block: Our Company - Hero
Horizontal Positioning of Item in parent. Allows for text to wrap around images, or items to stack next to each other.
Title should include "Display Flex" e.g. Display Flex: Our Company - Hero
Only Set this if you want the orientation to be different on phone
Flex Direction: Row is Default, row should only be chosen if you have to force direction.
Mobile Wrap Behaviour for Flex Container. Only Set this if you want the way items wrap to be different on phone
To wrap or not to wrap the Default is nowrap
On Mobile, Justify Content on axis. e.g. x-axis if flex-direction is row, y-axis if flex-direction is column.
Justify Content on axis. e.g. x-axis if flex-direction is row, y-axis if flex-direction is column.
On Mobile, Align Items on cross axis. e.g. y-axis if flex-direction is row, x-axis if flex-direction is column.
Align Items on cross axis. e.g. y-axis if flex-direction is row, x-axis if flex-direction is column.
Defaults Flex-Start, tells grouping of children how to fill vertical space. Differs from Align-Items but works on same axis.
Gaps btwn items. Single value is applied for rows and columns (10px), two values are rows then columns (10px 20px)
Override Mobile (Default) gaps btwn items. Single value is applied for rows and columns (10px), two values are rows then columns (10px 20px)
Title should include "Display Flex" e.g. Display Flex: Our Company - Hero
This allows for a single item to break the settings of the parent without disrupting.

Default 1, will grow. A value of 0 means this item will not change size. Values >= 1 are relative measurements. An item with a value of 2 will take up approximately 2x the amount of space as an item with the value 1.
Default 1, will shrink. A value of 0 will not shrink. Values >= 1 are relative to other sibling values.
Order of item in flex container.
Override default (or Mobile) order of item with in flex container.

This is a Minimum Width, it is a fixed pixel value based on 4px(n) e.g. 12 * 4px = 48px or 3rem
Overrides the default (mobile) size: This is a Minimum Width, it is a fixed pixel value based on 4px(n) e.g. 12 * 4px = 48px or 3rem
Name For Width Setup where Descriptive Value is something like w-full to ab-content-size
This is a Max Width, it is a fixed pixel value based on 4px(n) e.g. 12 * 4px = 48px or 3rem. Full width options are relative and can be used to override defaults.

Overrides the default (mobile) size: This is a Maximum Width, it is a fixed pixel value based on 4px(n) e.g. 12 * 4px = 48px or 3rem. Full width options are relative and can be used to override defaults.
